rojut
Class Octree

java.lang.Object
  rojut.Octree

public class Octree
extends java.lang.Object

Search tree for mapping RGB colors to palette indices. While time requirement of octree mapping, O(log N), is significantly less than finding the lowest RGB distance, which takes O(N), its color accuracy is slightly worse than connecting color to lowest distance in RGB space.

Usage: after the palette is created, put its color references to this octree with setPalette(). Then most suitable palette indices for colors in RGB space can be found by calling mapColor for each color. Color mapping to a different palette can be changed calling setPalette() again.

Author:
Artturi Tilanterä

Field Detail

MAX_DEPTH

private static final int MAX_DEPTH
Maximum depth of the tree. This is the same as the bit depth of each color component {R, G, B}.

See Also:

Root node of the tree.

Method Detail

setPalette

public void setPalette(short[] palette)
Adds color values of an image into octree.

Parameters:
palette - 256 color palette with each color with components R, G, B, in order RGB RGB RGB.

mapColor

public int mapColor(int r,
                    int g,
                    int b)
Finds the most suitable palette index for the RGB color specified.

Parameters:
r - value of the red component of the color, 0..255.
g - value of the green component of the color, 0..255.
b - value of the blue component of the color, 0..255.
Returns:
the most suitable palette index.

private void clear()
Removes the color references from the tree.

Adds a color reference into octree.

Parameters:
r - red component of the color, value 0..255.
g - green component of the color, value 0..255.
b - blue component of the color, value 0..255.
